pr_title: HDDS-4332: ListFileStatus - do lookup in directory and file tables

timeline.message: HDDS-4332: ListFileStatus - do lookup in directory and file tables

timeline.bodyText: Nit: this comment seems not accurate here.
timeline.author: linyiqun

replies.bodyText: Done
replies.author: rakeshadr

timeline.bodyText:
Can we use default replication type/factor:

OzoneConfigKeys.OZONE_REPLICATION_TYPE_DEFAULT
OzoneConfigKeys.OZONE_REPLICATION_DEFAULT
timeline.author: linyiqun

replies.bodyText:
I've followed existing logic during directory creation : OMDirectoryCreateRequest.java#L351.
OzoneConfigKeys.OZONE_REPLICATION_TYPE_DEFAULT is string object but
OmKeyInfo.Builder().setReplicationType(HddsProtos.ReplicationType.RATIS) requires enum ReplicationType. Changing code requires a conversion logic.
Also, OZONE_REPLICATION_DEFAULT is THREE but directory has a value ONE.
replies.author: rakeshadr

replies.bodyText: Okay, let us keep current logic here.
replies.author: linyiqun

timeline.bodyText: If we cannot find the first OzoneFileStatus based on given startKey. It means that there is no other  OzoneFileStatus matched. And we should return the empty list.
timeline.author: linyiqun

replies.bodyText: Done!
replies.author: rakeshadr

timeline.bodyText:
startKey can be a non-existed key here. We cannot just reuse getOzoneFileStatusV1 to find the OzoneFileStatus. getOzoneFileStatusV1 needs the key existed then it has the result.
Example,
key list:
/a/a
/a/c
/a/d
If given startkey: /a/b, here should return /a/c
timeline.author: linyiqun

replies.bodyText: Good point. I kept this as an open point now and not addressed in my latest commit. Need to do some more testing to understand the existing behavior.
replies.author: rakeshadr

replies.bodyText: Raised HDDS-4364 jira to handle this case.
replies.author: rakeshadr

timeline.bodyText:
We need to pass scmBlockSize as well:
OzoneFileStatus(keyInfo, 0, false) -> OzoneFileStatus(keyInfo, scmBlockSize, false)

replies.bodyText: Done

timeline.bodyText: We should reset prefixPath after we find the first ozone file info to list.
timeline.author: linyiqun

replies.bodyText:
Good catch. With recursive flag false, prefix path will always be same as user given keyname. But with recursive flag true, it can change between two pages, if the second page is iterating on the sub-dirs of the given user keyname.
I have raised separate jira HDDS-4360 to handle the recursive logic. IMHO that would be helpful to do more focussed development.
replies.author: rakeshadr

replies.bodyText: Yes, the logic for recursive makes this more complex.
replies.author: linyiqun

timeline.bodyText: Should reset prefixPath to bucketKey I think.
timeline.author: linyiqun

replies.bodyText: "/vol/bucket/" is the root directory and the first level directories are under this. Thats the reason I left, prefixPath as empty. PrefixPath is used to build the absolute key path name which will be added to the OMKeyInfo#keyName. Existing code base don't have volume/bucket name in the key path name.
replies.author: rakeshadr

replies.bodyText:
Thanks for correct me. I am thinking more for this, here the case is that we cannot find the expected key info due to a non-exist key name, right. So maybe we should just return the empty list. Because we give a wrong key name.
Above logic lists the first level directories are under this, this is for the case when key name is empty. For the key name is not empty, empty list expected to be returned.
replies.author: linyiqun

replies.bodyText:
Yes, this condition is for the root directory listing. fileSystem.listStatus(new Path("o3fs://bucket1.vol1/"))
For a wrong or non-existing keyname, today it is throwing exception. I have referred code base KeyManagerImpl.java#L1823
replies.author: rakeshadr

replies.bodyText: Okay, get it.
replies.author: linyiqun

timeline.bodyText: Additionally, startKey needs to be normalized when FileSystemPaths enabled, related JIRA: HDDS-4117
timeline.author: linyiqun

replies.bodyText: Thanks a lot for pointing out this. Since the startKey value is internally taken from the OMKeyInfo.keyName, I thought the path would have already been in the normalized form. I saw startKey normalization in PR #1451, I would like to hear from @bharatviswa504 about the plans and follow the same logic here as well.
replies.author: rakeshadr

replies.bodyText: Seems the keyName in OmKeyArgs already be normalized. But startKey is not included in that, it's an independent parameter passed in here. So the PR #1451 did the fix for this.
replies.author: linyiqun

replies.bodyText: Noted and will add TODO in V1 code. I will watch #1451 progress and will incorporate that logic in V1 once that PR is merged. Hope that make sense to you?
replies.author: rakeshadr

replies.bodyText: Makes sense to me.
replies.author: linyiqun

timeline.bodyText:
Currently, CreateFile/CreateDir of V1 version also add entry into double buffer cache first, then flush to db. So seems we still need to combine the result from table cache and db.
For the further DeleteFile/DeleteDir API implement, we may still follow this table cache way. Not fully understand why here we say ' deleted keys are marked directly in directory table'. Current write type request always operate the cache first, then flush to db I think.
timeline.author: linyiqun

replies.bodyText:
Thanks @linyiqun for pointing out this case. I have implemented File & Dir Table cache logic in latest commit. As the plan is to update the Dir & FileTable directly during delete api, ideally there is no need of considering deletedTableCache. Will revisit this logic once we implement the delete api.
I have commented in HDDS-4358 jira
replies.author: rakeshadr

replies.bodyText: Okay, makes sense to me.
replies.author: linyiqun

timeline.message: Fixed review comments - startKey, tableCache functionality

timeline.bodyText:
For this branch, we use startKey to get the key info and it's a file in key table. So we will not have the same key string as startKey in dir table. Here I think we should just return one  single file
Collections.singletonList(fileStatusInfo);
timeline.author: linyiqun

replies.bodyText:
As we have to perform seek in two tables to finish the listing, I'm maintaining a seek order

Seek all the files from FileTable, then
Start seeking dirs from DirTable.

Thats the reason for continuing seek the given key in DirTable using logic:
            // begins from the first sub-dir under the parent dir
            seekDirInDB = metadataManager.getOzonePathKey(prefixKeyInDB, "");

For example: OM has a namespace like,
/a/1...1M files and /a/dir1...dirM directories

keyName='/a' and its objectId is "1027/"

Here, iterate to finish all 1M files using the startKey indexes and then move the parent pointer to '1027/' to seek the contents from DirTable. Now, onwards the startKey represents directory entires. Once all dirs are listed thats the break point and come out to send response back to the user #lisStatus API call.
replies.author: rakeshadr

replies.bodyText:
Hi @rakeshadr , I agreed with the case you mentioned. That's the case when there is no entry key name exactly
equals to startKey. And then we need to lookup the file table, dir table.
Can you check below corner case I am thinking here:
FileTable
/a/a1
/a/a1_2
DirTable
/a/a12
Here we pass startKey /a/a1 and find the target file entry which name is completely matched, then we still need to list FileTable, DirTable and get /a/a1_2,  /a/a12 entry?
If  /a/a1_2,  /a/a12  is expected to return under startKey semantic, I'm okay for current logic.
replies.author: linyiqun

replies.bodyText:
Thanks @linyiqun for the detailed example case.
yes, it will first finish fetching the FileTable entries and then do fetching the DirTable entries of keyname /a.
For the startKey /a/a1 , it will return list [/a/a1, /a/a1_2, /a/a12].
In BasicOzoneFileSystem client it will skip the first entry and prepare subList without duplicates startKey.
Please refer BasicOzoneFileSystem.java#L591 for the client side sublist logic to filter out startKey from the return list.
replies.author: rakeshadr

replies.bodyText: Get it, thanks for the confirmation, @rakeshadr .
replies.author: linyiqun

replies.bodyText: yes, it should be under the bucket lock. The caller KeyManagerImpl#getOzoneFileStatusV1() has acquireReadLock and hope thats enough?

We are using that countEntries but listStatusFindFilesInTableCache is not returning that.

We need to consider count from this during total count when iterating from cache.

timeline.bodyText: Question: Do we need this second check when startKey is blank?
timeline.author: bharatviswa504

replies.bodyText:
Sorry, I failed to understand the "second check". Are you asking about cacheKey.compareTo(seekKeyInDB) this?
If yes, this is required for listing files/dirs under the keyname.
replies.author: rakeshadr

replies.bodyText:
OK, based on the offline discussions I will remove the cacheKey.compareTo(seekKeyInDB) >= 0 check. Adding discussion details to make the scenario clear to all.
'seekKeyInDB' will have two type of values.
      1. "1024/"   -> startKey is null or empty
      2. "1024/b"  -> startKey exists
replies.author: rakeshadr

timeline.bodyText: Minor NIT: Can we maintain similar order for parameters for getFilesFromDirectories and getDirectories it will be easy to follow while reading code, as it has many parameters.
timeline.author: bharatviswa504

replies.bodyText: Done!
replies.author: rakeshadr

timeline.author: bharatviswa504

replies.bodyText: Done!
replies.author: rakeshadr

timeline.bodyText:
When startKey is passed, we seek to that and to construct keyName we used keyArgs keyName as keyName and construct the paths.
But let's say
KeyArgs keyName /a/b
startkey is /f/d
Then we have used parentObjectID and seek and then return all keys in directory /f, but we construct keyNames with prefix as "/a/b".
Do you think we need to have a check when startKey is passed is the parentObjectID is same when recursive is false. To avoid this kind of corner case scenarios?
timeline.author: bharatviswa504

replies.bodyText:
As I'm implementing only recursive=false cases in this patch, it will return list with only immediate files/dirs. In your example, the keyname is  /a/b, then it will list only upto  /a/b/f. It won't have  /a/b/f/d entry in the result list.
KeyArgs keyName /a/b
startkey will be in the fashion /a/b/f. It will be full path, right?.
I believe the case what you mentioned will occur when I'm doing recursive=true in jira HDDS-4360, am I correct?
replies.author: rakeshadr

replies.bodyText:
Based on offline discussions, added a case to safe check to verify startKey is an immediate child of keyName.
Following are the valid parentKey formats:
    parentKey="" or parentKey="/" or parentKey="/a" or parentKey="a"
Following are the valid startKey formats, which is called as childKey:
    childKey="/" or childKey="/a/b" or childKey="a/b"
replies.author: rakeshadr

timeline.message: Fixed Review comments - added isImmediateChild check for startKey, updated seekInDB comparison

timeline.bodyText: Minor: Is this needed here?
timeline.author: bharatviswa504

replies.bodyText: Sure, will take care along with refactoring jira.
